title: Elegant serif (didot / bodini family?)
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317172300im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-07-25%20at%2018_6642.25.02.png)

Hello Typophiles,

I would really appreciate it if you could help me with the name of this gorgeous typeface — I appreciate it has most likely been treated, but even the original would be great.

Have an awesome weekend!

Paul

Font: 

 Domaine 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317172300/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

author: paul_w

comments.content:
Reminds me of Lust [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/lust/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317172300/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/lust/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/lust/") but this seems to be a lighter weight.  
Don

Domaine, by Klim Type Foundry:

[https://klim.co.nz/retail-fonts/domaine-display/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317172300/https:/klim.co.nz/retail-fonts/domaine-display/ "https://klim.co.nz/retail-fonts/domaine-display/")

Other than some tighter kerning, it doesn't appear to have been altered.
